intro: Rosa sempervirens subvar. brevistyla, commonly known as the evergreen rose or creeping evergreen rose, is a shrub native to the western Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its dense, thorny stems and evergreen foliage that remains lush throughout the year. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of pink to white, typically blooming in spring. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens or as a ground cover. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, exhibiting good drought tolerance once established.
